qas.question: In what year was the friars' water supply system built in Southampton?
Where was the water brought from by the friars' supply system?
What year did the friars start letting the rest of Southampton use the water from their system?
When was ownership of the medieval water supply system given to the town of Southampton?
What's the name of the landmark on Commercial Road where remains of the friars' water system can be seen?

context: Elsewhere, remnants of the medieval water supply system devised by the friars can still be seen today. Constructed in <a0_0>1290<a0_0/>, the system carried water from <a1_0>Conduit Head<a1_0/> (remnants of which survive near Hill Lane, Shirley) some 1.7 kilometres to the site of the friary inside the town walls. The friars granted use of the water to the town in <a2_0>1310<a2_0/> and passed on ownership of the water supply system itself in <a3_0>1420<a3_0/>. Further remains can be observed at <a4_0>Conduit House<a4_0/> on Commercial Road.
